sen.j: 朱雀天皇（すざくてんのう、延長元年7月24日（923年9月7日） - 天暦6年8月15日（952年9月6日）、在位：延長8年11月22日（930年12月14日） - 天慶9年4月13日（946年5月16日））は第61代の天皇。
sen.e: Emperor SUZAKU (September 7th, 923 - September 6th, 952), his reign was December 14th, 930 - May 16th, 946), he was the 61st Emperor.
Emperor Suzaku (September 7, 923 - September 6th, 952) was the sixty-first Emperor (his reign was December 14, 930 to May 16th, 946).

sen.j: 立太子の背景には、兄保明親王とその子慶頼王の二代にわたる東宮の夭折があり、母后穏子は怨霊を恐れて、幾重にも張られた几帳の中で寛明親王を育てたという。
sen.e: In the background how he became Crown Prince was previous Crown Prince, both his brother Prince Yasuakira and his son Prince Yoshiyori died young, thus the mother, Onshi was scared of bad spirit and looked after Prince Yutaakira inside the layered of Kicho. In the background how he became the crown prince was that the previous crown princes--his brother Prince Yasuakira and his son, Prince Yoshiyori--died young, thus the mother, Onshi, was afraid of bad spirits and looked after Prince Yutaakira within the layered Kicho (a partition of fabric used during the Heian period).

sen.j: 延長8年（930年）醍醐天皇の崩御を受け同年9月の践祚後、11月に8歳で即位。
sen.e: In 930, after Emperor DAIGO died, he succeeded to the throne in November when he was eight years old.

sen.j: 政治は、伯父藤原忠平が摂政関白として取り仕切っていた。

sen.j: 懐柔策を試みたがうまくいかず、天慶3年（940年）、藤原忠文を征夷大将軍に任命して将門征伐軍を送り、藤原秀郷の手により将門は討たれた。
sen.e: The government tried to conciliate the incident however it failed, in 940 FUJIWARA no Tadafumi was appointed as barbarian-quelling generalissimo to send the troops to defeat Masakado, FUJIWARA no Hidesato subjugated Masakado.

The government tried to reconcile the incident but it failed, so in 940 FUJIWARA no Tadafumi was appointed as Seii Raishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") to send the troops to defeat Masakado, FUJIWARA no Hidesato subjugated Masakado.

sen.j: 治世中はこのほかにも富士山の噴火や地震・洪水などの災害・変異が多く、また皇子女に恵まれなかったこともあってか、朱雀天皇は早々と同母弟成明親王（後の村上天皇）に譲位し、仁和寺に入った。
sen.e: During Emperor SUZAKU's reign, there were many disasters or abnormal changes, such as eructation of Fuji Mountain or earthquake and flooding, not only that the Emperor did not have any children, he abdicated to pass the throne to his half younger brother, Prince Nariakira (later called Emperor MURAKAMI) and left the Imperial Palace to live in Ninna-ji Temple.
